Reviews.Title: “Stayed here during a study abroad trip”
Reviews.Author: Aberfitchfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the apartments during a study abroad trip with my class to Berlin. It was actually a very good hotel, and the people working were very helpful. It also is very easy to get to using public transportation. The rooms were clean, the bathroom was clean, and the breakfast in the morning was great. I would stay here again and would recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: sarahdeej
Reviews.Content: Two friends from South Africa & I stayed for 5 nights and loved the Alex Hotel. On tight budgets we opted for a three bed room - anticipating a slightly cramped room (hotel photo's are always misleading, no!?) & being out all day. It couldn't have been more different. Our room was spacious, light, airy and so clean (we are all a little OCD about this!) and looked onto a quiet courtyard despite the central location. Although I realise this is not true of all the rooms. The staff are also a delight. After the "service" offered by others in Berlin it was always lovely to come back to smiles, laughter & helpfulness. Busses to Museum Island are 2 minutes away & the tram is outside the door. (But be warned numbers on the left do not correlate so no 3 is opposite no 220 or something similar!) Although the selection is a small - breakfasts were very good too. We all had flu and spent a lot of time in our room and felt so at home and not cramped at all! Thats 3 sick women all together so that says something. You could not wish for better value for money. Oh and try the DELIGHTFUL Turkish place next door. The food was great and the service excellent) Note that the English menu hasn't included 2 pages from the German so get both - particularly the veggies as that section is missing. We stayed till nearly 1am - by now on a complimentary glass to thank us for our tip! They were so lovely we went back the next day for lunch too!

Reviews.Title: “A good bargain and location”
Reviews.Author: sfoggy
Reviews.Content: I had to make reservations at the last minute and found the Alex Hotel through bookings.com. Their rate was good and included a nice breakfast. One review said there were better deals out there, but I found their price to be competitive and I liked the location. It is a basic european style hotel with fully renovated modern bathrooms and additional perks like in room safes, blow dryers, and tv. The management was friendly and helpful and there is a computer available for guests to check email. The tram to Alexander Platz is just outside the hotel and the underground is about two blocks away. There is wonderful park around the corner for jogging or relaxing. Its location on the edge of Prenzluerburg near the Mitte and Frederichshain Districts is very convenient. There are nice restaurants and Cafes nearby, the big clubs in Frederichshain are within walking distance and Museum island is an easy trip. The only negative is that there were large student groups which tended to be a bit noisy. The rooms are very basic and small, but attractive and comfortable. The breakfast is a bit better than average and coffee and tea are available all day. The lobby/breakfast room has wi-fi, which I didn't utilize, but after breakfast it is a comfortable place to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: JamesD101
Reviews.Content: A great budget hotel. The staff was great. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast generous and complementary. The location is a bit off the beaten track but there are great trams and buses a right out front. Renting a bike is also a great option to get around town. Overall very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Hanne1602
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice standards, with breakfast from 7 - 12 am and free internet. It is very clean and you get just what you pay for. If you want to stay at an ok price but still like your room clean - go to alex :-)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: THMunk
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from the most horrible hotel i've ever stayed at. We payed for a large room with 5 beds, shower and a kitchen, but all we got was a 15 square meter room with four beds and a tiny bathroom. We paid the same price as everyone else in our group, but got a much worse room. The staff was rude and inconvenient. A number of the females in our group was verbally abused by the staff. Alcoholics were forbidden in our room, but allowed in others. There was apparently no storage room for our luggage after checkout. Most of the staff couldn't understand english. This wasn't a cheap stay, and you can find hundreds of cheaper and better hotels in Berlin. Just stay away from the rotten ones, like this.

Reviews.Title: “Four thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: YXEinWAW
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I shared an apartment at the Alex Hotel for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were a little surprised at the layout of our small apartment; the room with two of the beds contained a very small kitchenette while the room with the remaining two beds was small indeed. Though surprised, we settled into the area comfortably though guests wanting spacious rooms may be disappointed. We were impressed with the renovated look and appreciated the spotless cleanliness. The area immediately around the hotel offers little though the park nearby made for a beautiful jogging retreat for my morning run. However, the Alexanderplatz is a mere ten-minute walk away and the #4 tram stops, literally, right outside the door of the hotel so getting to the heart of Berlin was a breeze. The complimentary breakfast was fresh which we enjoyed in the dining area near the entrance, a design which presented a pleasant "coffee house" ambiance. Finally, the friendliness of the state can't possibly be overstated. A final bonus was the free wifi available in our room. Overall, any one of us would not only stay at the Alex hotel again, but would enthusiastically recommend it to our friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel posing as a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Currywurst1
Reviews.Content: The images on the website give the impression of quite a funky little hotel. However, they do not give a very true impression. This has the feel of a hostel that has been given a basic cosmetic makeover in order to achieve better rates. Our room was quite big but really poorly laid out. The internet access was not working when we stayed either. On the positive side the breakfast was ok and it is located close to a tram station. The staff were quite friendly too. However, on balance the 'hotel' is not worth the money (and we managed to negotiate a lower than standard rate too). There are much better options available.

Reviews.Title: “In the shadow of the Alexanderplatz Tower”
Reviews.Author: Matti-Pringle
Reviews.Content: After a booking misunderstanding in my previous hotel, I de-camped to Alex Hotel and was pleasantly surprised! I was informed that the establishment has been operating as a hotel for just over a year. Nonetheless, management and staff seem to be getting a great deal right: this is a very pleasant, friendly hotel, situated in the looming shadow of Alexanderplatz Tower, which is a short ten minute walk away. Alternatively, hop on the tram outside. If you are expecting a traditional German hotel or the luxury of a Marriott, you will probably be disappointed. However, the Alex Hotel offers the traveller a warm, modern ambience, simple, albeit spotlessly clean rooms, and a hearty breakfast on which to explore beautiful Berlin or to attack a day full of meetings. In short, the place is ideal for tourists and business folk alike.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jennette33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in East Berlin on Greifswalder Strasse, a ten minute walk from Alexanderplatz (there is also a tram with a stop right outside the hotel). There is not much going on in the direct vicnity of this hotel, except for housing blocks, graffiti, and a couple of heavy metal clubs... but it's walking distance to the hipper, gentrified areas of Prenzlauer Berg with plenty of restaurants and bars. The hotel itself is new, clean, and modern. Our room was small, minimal, but comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly, and the buffet breakfast was extensive. At the time of our stay, although wifi was advertised as being available throughout the hotel it only worked in the lobby area, which was not a problem for us since the staff explained that they were in the process of fixing the problem. I would not recommend this hotel to travelers who prefer location and luxury, but to couples or groups in their twenties or thirties who are on a budget and enjoy walking. Overall, we were satisfied with our experience at Alex Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks the boxes but ambience is lacking something”
Reviews.Author: choosy_traveller07
Reviews.Content: From the outside it looks like a cafe. This is in fact the breakfast room. If you want a hotel that is clean, modern, tastefully decorated, value for money, reasonable location, pretty good breakfast, with helpful though slightly off-beat / unconventional staff, then this is for you. If however you want a more traditional type of hotel in terms of staff / reception, it isnt. I had a couple of friends join me in the breakfast room and i was told it was no problem for them to help themselves to coffee, which was much appreciated.

HotelInfo.Name: Alex Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Greifswalder Strasse 3 | Prenzlauer Berg, 10405 Berlin, Germany
